REQ-MIL-001.title: Six Unit Types
REQ-MIL-001.notes: Foundational spec - defines 6 unit types (Soldiers, Fighters, Bombers, Stations, Light Cruisers, Heavy Cruisers, Carriers). No dependencies.

REQ-MIL-002.title: Build Queue System

blockers.reason: Build queue progress increments per turn; requires turn processing system
Needs unit type definitions; can implement with stub units initially

REQ-MIL-002.notes: Multi-turn production queue system. Resources deducted upfront, units complete after N turns.

REQ-MIL-003.title: Resource Costs

blockers.reason: Costs use Credits, Ore, Petroleum, Food resources; can hardcode resource names

REQ-MIL-003.notes: Defines build costs for each unit type. Ranges from 100cr (Soldiers) to 30,000cr (Carriers).

REQ-MIL-004.title: Maintenance Costs
REQ-MIL-004.notes: Per-turn upkeep costs for completed units. Formula: Σ(Unit Maintenance Cost). Referenced by REQ-RES-005.

REQ-MIL-005.title: Production Time

blockers.reason: Production time measured in turns (1-5 turns); requires turn increment

REQ-MIL-005.notes: Build times: Soldiers 1 turn, Fighters/Bombers 2 turns, Stations 3 turns, Cruisers/Carriers 4-5 turns.

REQ-MIL-006.title: Power Multipliers

blockers.reason: Power multipliers used in combat power calculation; can define multipliers without combat

REQ-MIL-006.notes: Unit power: Soldiers 0.1×, Fighters 1.0×, Bombers 2.0×, Stations 3.0× (6.0× defending), Light Cruisers 4.0×, Heavy Cruisers 8.0×, Carriers 12.0×.

REQ-MIL-007.title: Cost-to-Power Efficiency
REQ-MIL-007.notes: Analytical spec - compares unit costs to power output. Fighters/Bombers most efficient, Cruisers/Carriers premium power.

REQ-MIL-008.title: Composition Bonus

blockers.reason: 4+ unit types = +15% diversity bonus; combat system calculates bonus

REQ-MIL-008.notes: Encourages fleet diversity. Requires 4+ distinct unit types for +15% power bonus. Defined in COMBAT-SYSTEM REQ-COMBAT-005.

REQ-MIL-009.title: Domain Assignment

blockers.reason: Units assigned to SPACE/ORBITAL/GROUND domains; requires three battle types system

REQ-MIL-009.notes: Units must be assigned to combat domains: Soldiers (GROUND), Fighters (SPACE/ORBITAL), Bombers/Stations (ORBITAL), Cruisers/Carriers (SPACE).

REQ-MIL-010.title: No Unit Caps
REQ-MIL-010.notes: Design decision - no hard cap on unit count. Natural limits from resource scarcity and maintenance costs.
